intro: Viola × intersita, commonly known as the common violet, is a hybrid species within the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant is native to Europe and has been widely cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Viola × intersita is often found in gardens and woodland areas, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the ecosystem.
